artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kameya Iwakichi; Carver: Koizumi Kanegorō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 28; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unattached diptych: group of motely figures and a dog huddle under large tree at L; hairy creature with fangs and yellow eyes under umbrella runs towards tree; male and female figures at R also head towards tree; sky is gray, with rain
markings: R: 小泉彫兼 {Koizumi hori Kane} | L: 彫兼 {hori Kane} | Censor seal: 申八改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: R: 好にまかせて芳年筆 {konomi ni makasete Yoshitoshi hitsu} | L: 好にまかせて芳年戯筆 {konomi ni makasete Yoshitoshi gihitsu}
title: Pictures from Ōtsu
